While I am not the best climber, I do enjoy the challenge and fun of it. I thought that this gym had a great variety of climbs. I was impressed by the three completely different sections for each type of climbing: top roping, bouldering, and lead climbing. The staff were friendly, the gym itself was very clean and nicely set up. They even had a work out room in the back for the members. I had a ton of fun there. The one bad thing is the price. Maybe I'm just used to cheaper wall, but for me $16 dollar day entry fee seemed a little steep. Still if you are in town for the weekend and you want to go climbing for an hour or five, I highly recommend this place to do it.

Back in my younger days I used to frequent this gym in preparation for our climbs out in Idyllwild's Tahquitz rock...There were two indoor gyms we used to go to - this and another place called Alpine something...Rockreation was the better of the two.  The climbing walls here look more like actual rock.  Most other places you see will just be plywood walls with different flat angled surfaces and climbing holds bolted on.Before you can enter, you have to be certified to get onto the climbing walls - you demonstrate your ability to tie-in (using a double figure 8 knot), your knowledge of vocal belay commands, and your rope work as you belay someone.If you don't pass, you can still come in, but you're limited to the bouldering wall (a traversing wall that you climb horizontally, rather than vertically.When I went, it used to be $12 for the day, or you could purchase memberships for like $560 annually if you think you could go enough to make it worth the costs.It's a fun and safe way to learn how to rock climb, each climb is about 30 feet, and if you get really good, you can give a try on the leading wall... that's where you're climbing "on the edge".They even have holds on the ceiling so you can make it as challenging or as easy as you want.  If you're tired of going to a regular gym and want to try something a little different, give Rockreation a try!

Great place for messing around!  Went for a company meeting - the staff is really nice - Rick and Mark were funny and seemed like they really enjoyed what they did.It's in a warehouse, so the OC location gets warm (no A/C), but they do have two roll-up doors to let the breezes in.I'm sure I'll be hurting tomorrow....
Cool indoor gym... different type of workout. The people are very cool and willing to help you out. The price of admission, equipment, and classes are very reasonable in my opinion.

What kind of people work at the front desk of this place? I tried to reserve a birthday party that is one month away. The person (male) who answered phone gave me the available time slot then demanded a head count for the party and told me that I am NOT allowed to go over that head count. Well, how would I know the head count for a party that I just go the time slot for? Then he went on and read the Terms and Conditions. After actually listening through that, I heard in the T&C that I can make change to the head count as long as it is 7 days before the event date. So I pointed it out. He read it again then admitted that it is fine. Then he went on and demanded $50 for deposit. I informed him that I have already purchased a Groupon and paid $99. He didn't know how that works and replied that he CAN NOT continue making the reservation without a credit card. I advised him to have his manager call me. I see no point of giving someone my credit card information when I had already paid. He said fine. Before I had a chance to ask for his name, he was talking to other people there... quote 'What the F*ck. Fine. Don't give me the damn credit card info'. I am waiting for their manager to call back, if I ever get one. Needless to say, we will not have our party there.

So I packed up all my climbing gear to return to this wonderful gym on a recent SoCal trip.It's a small place relative to what we have in the Bay Area, but the routes are better for training.  They are short but very challenging.The lead wall made me want to do something climbing friends couldn't do for 5 years - convince me to sign up for the lead class when I get back to SF!  This gym makes climbing accessible.The weights area is decent, and there is a magazine rack in the back for those who just want to chill.  Got to love the chilled water fountain v. the room-temperature one.  They also heat the locker area, so it's toasty after the shower.The only drawback is the belay testing.  They have an actual climber "pretend" to fall, and that was dangerous!  What if someone wasn't able to stop in time?!!
This gym is very mellow and professional. The facility is the best by far in Orange County. It has the most lead climbing space and isn't run down like the other one I've been to in Orange County.

The facility and staff are AMAZING!  We recently had our son's 10th birthday party at this location and they did a fantastic job!  The staff members were friendly and got all the party-goers involved with games ... plus offered plenty of climb time. The kids all had a super fun time!  Can't say enough nice things about this place!   They're helpful, polite and terrific with kids!   We'll be back for sure and know others from our party will too!   Thanks so much!

Great place to learn rock climbing, I took the OCC class which is the better deal, especially if you're unsure whether you want to start doing the sport.  A lot of routes are pretty advanced since members have been climbing for years.  It's one of the better rock climbing gyms I've been to in the area

I got a gift certificate for this place and finally had a chance to check it out. I'd been indoor rock climbing before in San Diego and really enjoyed it, so I was really looking forward to this trip. The instructional class was very helpful, especially since you had to tie knots for your security as opposed to just clipping into your harness like other places do. Safety definitely comes first here with the instructors, so beginners will feel very comfortable. Our instructor was a really cool and patient guy with lots of great tips. The facility itself was more than adequate with lots of room for people to climb but not feel crowded. And if you become a member, they also have a full size gym for you to use. Overall, a great time and if you're looking for something different to do, I highly recommend Rockreation and their staff. The only bummer was renting climbing shoes. Kinda smelly and gross, but you gotta expect that!

i have a friend who loves rock climbing and brought a group of us here.  we took turns climbing the walls while he belayed us.  it was a lot of fun, although a little tiring.  the trick to rock climbing is using your legs and not your arms to go higher.  i pooped out after 2 and a half walls, they're pretty high.hopefully, you know someone who can belay you, or else you'll have to pay for that.a fun way to get some exercise.

This was my first experience with rock climbing.   Some friends invited me to take some lessons with them, and I couldn't turn down a little adventure.  I had the time and workout of my life!  The instructors and staff were very helpful and provided an atmosphere of both safety and fun.  I am excited to return.

This is an ok place.  I think I'm spoiled by Planet Granite in Sunnyvale and MIssion Cliffs in SF, but the walls here are shorter and there aren't as much routes.  I like how they have features on the wall though, Planet Granite doesn't do that.  People here seem pretty friendly.  Seems like an overall nice place to climb.

So I'm bumping up my review to this place, I am thoroughly addicted to rock climbing now, even though I am quite terrible.  I've invested in my own gear and look forward to turning this into a wonderful, safe, new hobby. The employees are pretty nice and the people that come here are pretty down to earth (outdoorsy, you can tell).  I just hate to feel so physically inferior to all of these flexible, strong people - but that's ok - something to aspire to so long as I don't injure myself.
Tried this place once, my butt is too but to climb those walls ... however I think its a good sports for active people ...  climb on guys
It's the best rock climbing gym in the area. The staff are friendly and don't mind helping.  They change the routes reasonably frequent and a decent variety although most of it is in the 5.10 range.
